speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: Previously on The X Files...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was taken by men who subjected me to medical tests which left me barren.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are these?

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: Human ovaâ€”harvested during abduction.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm having a hard time explaining it. I'm pregnant.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: You got to breathe, Kath. In and out, in and out. You're panting.

speaker: KATH
line: Can't we just go home and start this all over again tomorrow?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: You're in safe hands now.

speaker: DELIVERY NURSE
line: How are we doing, Ms. McCready?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: I think she's getting ready.

speaker: DELIVERY NURSE
line: I'll check on her dilation. If she's close, then we'll call Dr. Lev.

speaker: KATH
line: What is that? What's that sound?

speaker: DELIVERY NURSE
line: It's the baby's heart monitor.

speaker: KATH
line: What's happening, Duffy? Something's happening.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Nurse, get the team in here for an emergency C-section.

speaker: KATH
line: Why? What's wrong?

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Baby's having some trouble. Some distress. We'll take care of it. We know what to do. You just lie back now.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Sir, you'll have to scrub if you're going to be here.

speaker: KATH
line: Duffy?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: It's all right. I'll be right back. Don't wait for me.

speaker: KATH
line: Please, please, just don't let anything happen to my baby.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Just lie back now. Let us do our work.

speaker: KATH
line: I can't... I can't feel anything. Something's wrong, isn't it?

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Lie down now, Mrs. McCready. You better hit her again.

speaker: KATH
line: Something wrong with my baby?

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Your baby's just fine.

speaker: KATH
line: Let me see. What is it? Is it a boy?

speaker: KATH
line: Oh, my god... Oh, my god.

speaker: KATH
line: Oh, my god, what is it? Duffy.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Put her under.

speaker: KATH
line: Duffy.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, Agent Doggett, I didn't realize that you had an appointment.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is Duffy Haskell. He says he knows you or you know him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry. I don't remember.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: I contacted you about my wife About eight years ago because she was an alien abductee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That was before my time here. But, uh, is there something I can help you with?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: She's dead. My wife is dead now. They killed her. Kath-- my wife.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I checked the files. Mr. Haskell wrote several letters to Agent Mulder describing his wife's abduction experiences.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: My wife gave birth to an alien.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I-I thought you said that your wife was murdered.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: That's the reason they did it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ooo-kay, Mr. Haskell. Why don't you, uh, start from the beginning.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: Kath was a multiple abductee. The aliens did these procedures on her. Tests and whatnot. One procedure would give her cancer while another one would cure her. Stuff like that. For years, you see. And then, this year, they came right into our bedroom and implanted an alien embryo in Kath.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't suppose that you have any, uh, medical proof of this.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: I have an ultrasound here. Anyone with a trained eye can see that is a bizarre pregnancy. Especially for a woman who was never supposed to be able to conceive. I doubt you'd ever get the doctors to cop to any of that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What doctors?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: We've been through three sets. They're all in on it. They're all in cahoots.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're... saying that it was the doctors that killed your wife?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: And stole the alien baby. That ultrasound is proof.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you, uh... have all the information and numbers and a way that we can reach Mr. Haskell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, we'll be in touch.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: Thank you. Thank you very much.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you, Agent Doggett. I'm sure the rest of my afternoon can't possibly be so amusing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I thought you'd find it interesting, actually.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Interesting? As in preposterous and outrageous?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, unless I'm mistaken you already knew that man's story. The abduction the tests, a bout with cancer then a remission.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly are you getting at?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's your story, Agent Scully. I'd say right down to a tee.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I mean, except for the pregnancy. It's all right there in the X-Files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I appreciate your thoroughness, Agent Doggett, and your familiarity with the X-Files cases in those cabinets, but my personal files are my personal files. Okay?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sure, of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: There you are. I've been looking all over for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. Um, I'm sorry. I had a doctor's appointment and, um, I don't know, I guess time just got away from me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is anything the matter?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing. No, I just, uh... I went for a walk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm. Then what's wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm... I'm sorry I haven't told you. I don't know why I haven't. I mean, you were always there for me during my illness but, um...

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't make me guess.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was left unable to conceive with whatever test that they did on me. And I am not ready to accept that I will never have children.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, there's, um, there's something I haven't told you either and I hope you, uh, forgive me and understand why I would have kept it from you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: During my investigation into your illness I found out the reason why you were left barren. Your ova were taken from you and stored in a government lab.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You found them?

speaker: MULDER
line: I-I took them directly to a specialist who would tell me if they were okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you were deathly ill, and I... I couldn't bear to give you another piece of bad news.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what it was? It was bad news?

speaker: MULDER
line: The doctor said that the ova weren't viable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want a second opinion.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully? What are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um, I don't know. I guess I just forgot to push the button.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I wasn't exactly clear on what you wanted to do about this guy Haskell. About his wife's story.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's nothing to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello. Is anybody here?

speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
line: This is my baby. I have to know...

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Ms. Hendershot, try to stay calm. I'm doing all I can....

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: No, listen to me. You don't know, you don't know.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Just try and stay calm. There are no similarities between your baby and the others.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: How can you say that? You don't know that.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Because I know both cases. Try to keep her as calm as possible. I'm going to get another doctor.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: No, no, I'm not staying here. I'm not staying here.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Who are you? What are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm, um, I'm here with my friend.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: You're here with Ms. Hendershot?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I'm worried about her.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Ms. Hendershot is fine. But you'll have to wait up front, please. You can't be back here.

speaker: SEFVICE
line: Parenti Medical Group.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I want to speak to Dr. Parenti, please.

speaker: SEFVICE
line: This is his service. I can reach him if it's an emergency.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, it is. It's Dana Scully.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Dana? What's wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Tell me what it is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to look at something for me. Right away. It's an ultrasound.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Well, I'm not in my office right now. Can you send it over there? I'll look at it as soon as possible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to compare it to mine.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Dana... are you going to be okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Fine, I'm... I'm okay.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: All right, I'll get back to you, Dana.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Ms. Scully? Got a good report for you. I've looked at the ova you've given me and consulted with some of my colleagues. We all feel that with the proper approach we might be successful. Got a good chance to get you pregnant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh... It's too good to be true.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: I don't want to lay odds but it's not out of the realm of possibility if we start soon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We can start right away?

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Well, you need a father, of course. I can get you genetic counseling on finding an anonymous donor if that's what you want... unless you already have someone in mind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah... I, uh... I just have to figure out how to ask him.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Dana? You want to come on back?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you find?

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: I looked at this ultrasound you sent me and... I don't know what I'm supposed to be seeing but it looks fine to me. As does your own ultrasound.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You didn't see anything strange?

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Why do you ask that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just want to be sure. I've had... complications.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: It's normal to be worried.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Thank you.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: You bet.

speaker: DR. PARENTI
line: Your only concern right now is when you're going to tell the FBI. Can't keep it a secret forever, Dana. You're going to start showing soon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay, got it. Thanks.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, I just got a call from a Dr. Parenti's office. About an ultrasound you left there this morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Parenti is my doctor.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Come on, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't believe me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That ultrasound is the one Duffy Haskell left here yesterday. Dr. Parenti is one of the doctors he consulted with during the course of that pregnancy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me, Agent Doggett, but are you investigating me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, I was doing a background check on Mr. And Mrs. Haskell before I dropped the case, like you asked me to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I didn't ask you to drop the case. I said there was nothing to do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, if there's nothing to do, then why are you investigating?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You are jumping to conclusions.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, I'm just trying to do my job, only it gets hard to do if the person you're working with is keeping secrets and telling lies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I am not investigating these people, Agent Doggett. Parenti is my doctor. Is that so strange? Is there something about him I don't know?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. But Duffy Haskell is a piece of work. I'll tell you that much.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: What am I being accused of? What did you call me in here for? You were going to help me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: As president of the Ohio Mutual UFO Network you sent Agent Mulder a series of very threatening letters which he passed on to me, Mr. Haskell. Something of a habit with you, sir. Writing letters... threatening letters. Isn't it?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: No one will believe me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You wrote a letter to a Dr. Lev saying you would kill him if he hurt your wife.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: Dr. Lev killed my wife. He stole the alien baby out of her womb.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I can't find any documentation that the two of you were even married, Mr. Haskell. Let alone any history or evidence of foul play. Dr. Lev is a serious physician, a leader in the field of birth defects. His peers hold him in the highest regard. Why would he ever kill your wife?

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: That's why I came to you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mr. Haskell, allegations aside, it's a crime to threaten anyone.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: You believe me, don't you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mr. Haskell, we're sorry for your loss, but if you persist in these threats and in disseminating these stories we're going to have to enter your name in the federal system as a dangerous individual.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: I'm alone now because of them. They took everything from me.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: And there are other women out there just like Kath.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Zeus Genetics, Dr. Lev speaking.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: They called me back here to the FBI to poke holes in my story.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: As we knew they would.

speaker: DUFFY HASKELL
line: We still risk losing Hendershot.

speaker: DR. LEV
line: Then it's time to let her go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can I take your coat?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I can't stay. I gotta get back to the office for a while.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Obviously you've had some time to think about my request.

speaker: MULDER
line: Um, it's... it's not something that I get asked to do every day. Um, but I am absolutely flattered.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, honestly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, if... if you're trying to politely say "no," it's okay. I, I understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: See what's weird is... this sounds, and this sounds really weird, I know, but I, I just wouldn't want this to come between us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I know... I, I understand. I do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well... the answer is "yes."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um... Well, I'll call Dr. Parenti and...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assume that he'll want to meet you and go through the, uh, the donor procedure.

speaker: MULDER
line: At that part, I'm a pro.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: My name is Mary Hendershot. My baby's in danger. So is yours.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I have some coffee-- black, please?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Sure.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thanks for getting down here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You going somewhere?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Am I missing something here?

speaker: [CARRIK
line: Are you ever, buddy.]

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett as Assistant Director in charge of your assignment Agent Scully has come to me and asked to take a leave of absence.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, great. Can I ask why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So I'm the X-Files now? Just me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully isn't quitting the FBI. She's just going away.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks for getting me out of bed to give me the news.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Drop me a line if you get a chance.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You gotta tell him, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to understand.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it you want me to understand, Agent Scully? The secrets or the lies?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told you... I'm not doing anything behind your back.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're supposed to watch my back, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If I was putting you at risk in any way you can be sure that I wouldn't let you down. I hope you know that. I only know what you tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I gotta go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who's that... In Agent Scully's car?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That I don't know, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: You're Scully? Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, Dana Scully. This is Ms. Hendershot. Mary Hendershot.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm Dr. Miryum. These are the best team of obstetricians one could hope to assemble. Now you tell them what you told me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ms. Hendershot believes that she is carrying a baby that is not her own. That, by whatever means, at 40 weeks she is about to give birth to something inhuman.

speaker: FIRST ASSOCIATE
line: Does she have medical records?

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: I can't trust my doctors.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She believes, and with possible good reason, that her life may be in danger. That women just like her have been murdered in childbirth.

speaker: SECOND ASSOCIATE
line: Why? Because it sounds insane.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: These doctors killed a friend of mine because she was on to them. Because she saw too much.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You should know that I'm not just here as an FBI agent.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: Agent Scully is an MD.

speaker: FIRST ASSOCIATE
line: So what is it she's carrying?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's why we've come to you.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: All right. Let's get Ms. Hendershot prepped and ready.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: For what?

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: You're going to have this baby, Ms. Hendershot. Our big concern right now is you have it safely. Whatever it is in you we'll know in a few hours from now if we induce labour immediately.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: How did this woman find you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A man named Haskell led her to me. His pregnant wife is now dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Miryum... she's not the only woman whose life is in danger.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Farah.

speaker: AGENT JOE FARAH
line: I didn't see you in here, John. What are you doing in the dark?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm in the dark pretty much most of my time on the X-Files, Joe.

speaker: AGENT JOE FARAH
line: Got a little something you may want to shine a light on.

speaker: AGENT JOE FARAH
line: You had me run this guy Duffy Haskell's prints, right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I hate to say that case is closed now, Joe.

speaker: AGENT JOE FARAH
line: From what I found, it's been closed since 1970. When David Haskell, same prints, was buried in a Virginia cemetery-- USMC honor guard ceremony.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're kidding.

speaker: AGENT JOE FARAH
line: I kid you not. Looks like you got yourself a real spook.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Or a snake in the grass.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: How long will this take?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Probably somewhere between four and 12 hours.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: All my life I wanted children. But I'm afraid of what's growing in me. That it even happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean getting pregnant?

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: I had a boyfriend. When I looked at the dates, there was no way. Now I'm sure it was an abduction. I'm sure of what's inside of me.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: Agent Scully... we're all set for you.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: You ready for this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: At your stage, the foetus is still only about eight centimetres, but we should still be able to get a pretty clear picture of its development.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: There it is. You see it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: I see two legs, two arms and hands. I see what would appear to be a healthy baby at 14 weeks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you sure?

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: The picture doesn't lie, Agent Scully. Hard to tell, but... would you like to know the sex?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just want to be certain that it's okay.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: We could do an amnio. It's a little early, but we could do it if that's what you want.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Knowle... can I talk to you?

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: John, what are you doing here?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Your assistant said you were going to get right back to me about this David Haskell fingerprint.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: I've got a day job, John. The government gets suspicious if I work at too fast a pace.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't wait, Knowle. Is it the same guy, or not?

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: How about we take a walk? How'd you hook up with this guy, anyway?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The man was in my office, Knowle. Military records show he died in 1970. What the hell's the story?

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: Possible He's intelligence.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Doing what? Working for who?

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: What did he say he wanted?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He wanted us to investigate the murder of his wife. He claims she was an alien abductee.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look... I don't buy this crap but if the guy's CIA he wasn't just in my office killing time.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: Why go to the trouble at all?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All I can think is that there must be documentation in our files of a conspiracy to hide the truth.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: About what, extraterrestrials?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, it's not my work. It's the woman I work with-- an Agent Scully.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: John, there's no conspiracy. You and I go back a long time. You know I'll do anything I can for you. Just give me a little more time to find out who this Haskell guy is, okay? By the end of the day.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: I know I don't have to tell you, but you need to take it easy now after the procedure. The baby's at risk if the membrane were to rupture, all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I just want to know. I'm anxious about the results.

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: Well, we're hoping Mrs. Hendershot will deliver in the next few hours. You're our next priority.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ms. Hendershot... you have to get up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to get you out of here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett, what is it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Scully-- do you know where she is? How to alert her right away?

speaker: SKINNER
line: To what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I think she's been misled. We all have by this man,Haskell.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You think or you know?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't get a straight answer on that which leads me to believe that this was a setup from the start-- that this guy Haskell came to us with his story to get Agent Scully to go wherever she's gone.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can tell you that she's in a safe place, Agent Doggett. A hospital.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What hospital?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, this involves doctors. Doctors who may have killed pregnant women. Now, a hospital could be the worst place in the world for her. Tell me where Scully is.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Walden-Freedman Army Hospital.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Get on the phone to security there. Tell them everything I told you.

speaker: SCURITY OFFICER
line: Security...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you do this?

speaker: DR. MIRYUM
line: We've got two patients missing .

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: I need you to follow us. I'm a friend of John Doggett's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you?

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: That's not important. Get in the car. We're going to get you out. Go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This woman could give birth at any minute. I hope you realize that.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: You're in good hands. These men are experienced field medics.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you taking us?

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: We're going to get you to the closest hospital where we can make sure this kid is born safe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: Are you going to make it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I just... just had a procedure. I shouldn't even be on my feet.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: Who the hell is this? Get off this road, now.

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: Oh!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Hendershot?

speaker: MRS. HENDERSHOT
line: I think it's coming.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have to stop this car.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: Not until it's safe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you don't stop this car you could be endangering her life.

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: Stop the car.

speaker: MEDIC
line: Just relax, ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: KNOWLES ROHRER
line: Making sure you don't hurt yourself, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fine. Let go of me.

speaker: KNOWLES ROHRER
line: It's for your own good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ms. Hendershot...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mary!

speaker: KNOWLES ROHRER
line: Agent Scully... we're going to have to sedate you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No!

speaker: KNOWLES ROHRER
line: Get in the car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here? What am I doing back in this place?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Lie down, Agent Scully. You're not taking any more chances.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're okay. You're fine. And your baby's fine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: But you're very, very lucky.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about Ms. Hendershot?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She's resting fine, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about her baby?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Six pounds, eight ounces. A boy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god. They switched it. Agent Doggett, they switched it on her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's over, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it's not. We can prove this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We can't prove anything. They say you overreacted to everything. They say you overreacted to fears you had about Ms. Hendershot's pregnancy, to the fears you had about your own.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They showed me a tape of another woman's womb.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They say it's your baby just taped onto an old cassette.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then who were those men?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They acted off information that came from me. They say they saved your life. How can I question that, standing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was all planned. You know that. From the moment that man walked into our office. we were used to get at Ms. Hendershot's baby. And now we are being used to cover it up. Oh, my God.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: At least you're okay. Why didn't you tell me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was afraid. Afraid that they'd use it against me to take me off the X-Files so that I couldn't find Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I told you I'd help you. I said we'd find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? I must have dozed off. I was waiting for you to get back.

speaker: MULDER
line: It didn't take, did it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess it was too much to hope for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was my last chance.

speaker: MULDER
line: Never give up on a miracle. the hospital holding her pillow. Her hand drifts down to her belly.)
